instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: Thunderbolt not working
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board. I dont have another board do swap and customer want to fix the thunderbolt.
I have 0.5V at <DIODE>D3895</DIODE> pin 1,2 and 0.582 diode mode after and 0.532 before- <DIODE>D3895</DIODE>
<SIGNAL>T29_A_HV_EN_R</SIGNAL> - 0V so I miss enable. I tested with thunderbolt connected with good known hdd with OS X.

Could be bad <CHIP>U3890</CHIP>? I am confused as I miss enable - <SIGNAL>T29_A_HV_EN_R</SIGNAL> so I dont know what to check next.

threads.title: Thunderbolt not working
threads.message: Yes, was liquid arround thunderbolt chip and lvds. Now everything works except thunderbolt.

threads.title: Thunderbolt not working
threads.message: Voltage on both sides of <DIODE>D9425</DIODE>? Nothing plugged into TB.

threads.title: Thunderbolt not working
threads.message: I really have no idea. Something corroded somewhere, this is just not something you want to fix.
